page.title: 09CABINET MAKER QUEEN CAMEL
page.content: The cabinet maker's shop was opened in 1977. Mr Robinson has been a cabinet maker since the age of 15, when he was apprenticed. Woods used include mahogony, oak, ash, beech, apple, yew, hazelwood and the rarer satin wood and rosewood.Wood comes from all over the country and he imports wood too.Applewood, however, he buys from local people.The wood must be dry so that it doesn't shrink.It is left in the air a year for every inch of thickness. Mr Robinson is very careful to choose the best wood for his furniture.The graining is most important.He uses mainly traditional hand tools,some are home made specialist tools.He also uses electric saws and lathes. Customers are mainly regular.
